ratings.comment: Dr. Saatchi is super caring towards his students. If you're struggling in this class, talk to him and he will kindly help. The grading system is also super lenient because this is an introductory class. Pay attention to example problems discussed in lectures because they are the ones that will be in the exams.

Quite possibly the worst professor Ive ever had. His lectures are absolutely useless, and you will need to learn everything from the book, which is by far the most useful resource in this class. The hw and exam questions are similar, so I have to give him credit for that at least. The pace of the class is very inconsistent too.
Genuinely kind lecturer that really cares for you.

I took MSE350 over this past summer and it was all online. Although Professor Saatchi wasn't the greatest at using technology, he was always online for office hours and even got online late at night to help with difficult assignments. His lectures are boring and didn't cover the material fully. I recommend reading the textbook over the lectures.
Lectures aren't of much use, but he is a fair prof. If you're alright with reading and reviewing slides outside of class, he's your guy.
He is a great guy, you have to work for your grade.

Overall he is just not great at lecturing but the way the class is organized is what is really flawed. He will basically just read off power point slides that summarize the 30 page readings he expects you to do between lectures. I eventually just took notes on the slides. Homework is can be hard since very few examples are done in lecture

Get ready to learn almost everything yourself and then go to lecture and talk about what you just read the previous night. The material isnt insane but lecture for me is nearly pointless aside from the quizzes and tophat activities.
The most boring and unmotivated educator that I have ever met

Dr. Saatchi is obviously passionate about his field and a nice guy, but unfortunately he isn't a great lecturer. He is a fair grader , but not clear in his "mini lectures" and you are forced to learn everything from the book yourself. The semester I took it, they switched it to an "active-learning" course and he didn't know how to teach that way.
The living meme and legend
THE REAL WISCONSIN EXPERIENCE
Awful!!!
Prof Saatchi is very hard to follow. His lectures are almost useless. I learned 80% of the material myself. Readings are insane and the quizzes can trip you up.

He's hard to understand while you manage to stay awake. He gives quizzes every day to see how everyone is doing, but when the average is 37% he gets mad and doesn't explain much more. The best way to pass this class is to read the book often, make sure you know how to do the homework and if that doesn't work ask specific questions.

Worst professor ever. Lectures consist of a daily quiz followed by random primitive noises, lip smacking, and mumbling as he attempts to explain the correct anwers to the quiz (with averages typically falling around 60%). After this mumblefest there are 15 min left to do 1 - 2 tophat questions, meaning no course content is ever covered.
wow..... just wow
Lectures sound like he is mumbling a memoir to himself. You are much better off taking this class online with some friends so that you can cheat on all the exams.
Ahmad is a really nice guy but his lectures leave a lot to be desired. Quizzes are worth way too much of the grade, but if you do decent on them and the exams you'll be fine.

Sure he has an accent and lectures are pretty boring, but the class isn't all that difficult and his grading scale is very generous. Also, he is very responsive to emails and accessible in office hours. The textbook isn't required, but it definitely helps.
If you want a professor that explains anything and gives fair quizzes, I suggest you find someone else... terrible professor
When I tried my best reviewing everything before exam and still couldn't do well, I realize there's something else wrong besides me being stupid.
The absolute worst. If you can take this online I would recommend that option.
Honestly less useful than sleeping through his class.
Awful, hard to understand what he is talking about

Saatchi's lectures are uninspiring in every respect; almost all information is read directly off the textbook's PowerPoint slides, and his speaking presence leaves a lot to be desired. However, I will say that he comes off as a kind person, and the grading scale allows you to neglect the class outside the weekly assignments and practice tests.
OK this is a bad class. But Prof. Saatchi has made it passable. He's helpful in office hour.

Professor Saatchi's lecture style is awful. You'd be better off watching online later at 1.6 speed and skipping to the useful parts (if you can find them). On the plus side, he teaches straight from the book so you can teach yourself from the book if you have to.
Very good. He knows the material well and is very helpful in office hour.

Professor Ahmad Saatchi knows his stuff and is honestly a very good teacher/explains everything in a clear manner. Please get past his kind of monotone voice (feel free to just watch the lectures at 1.4 speed). You can tell that he knows exactly what hes talking about and how to show it. Homework is fair and tests are fair, just put in the work.

It's true Dr. Saatchi's lecture is a little boring, but he is a very good instructor. He is very helpful and easy-going in office hour or if you talk with him after class, and the course itself is not that hard. You can't expect an A without any time spent on it except for copying homework from the solution manual.

These lectures are SO boring. He reads straight from the power point slides. The exams are half just memorizing vocab and the other half is memorizing how to solve the problems. The quizzes on monday mornings are ridiculous so learn how to use the "control/command f" function

His lectures consist of accented mumbling about the material in a way that's not much more helpful than the textbook. Tests and quizzes (all multiple choice) are very hard until you realize that the quiz questions are taken verbatim out of the multiple choice-type questions at the end of each chapter, and the tests are extremely similar to the practice exams he posts. Additionally, quizzes were Monday mornings at the beginning of class and were only open for 45 sec per question, so if you're late to class you'll get a terrible quiz score. Essentially, you won't learn much from him, but you can get a good grade if you can catch on quickly to how the class works. Do yourself a favor and take a professor that can teach instead. You're in college to actually learn, after all.

Very boring lecturer. Rambles through material for 50 minutes. Teaches straight from the text and reads exactly from slides. Tests were fair and heavily based on past exams. Homework was reasonable. Quizzes are taken verbatim from the end of chapter questions. Nice guy who is very fair with any personal circumstances you might have.
Hard to understand, gives impossible quizzes, doesn't fully understand what he's teaching
You have to work hard for it, yes he might have an accent but he knows his stuff.

I took the 3-week, 3 hrs a day summer session of this because of the course's bad rep, this is the best option. Poor lecturer, thick accent, but teaches STRAIGHT from the textbook so teaching yourself from the book WILL happen. Summer class quizzes are daily and NOT ONLINE. Tests are mostly theory based. Ask around for textbook solutions, they help

First off Saatchi is an amazingly nice guy.  He really is quite accommodating to situations, and will help you in any way he can.  The main problem with him isn't really him at all, it's the class.  It's a very basic course, and you can tell that he loves this topic, but because there is so much material, he cannot focus on one subject for long.
Professor Saatchi is the worst professor I have had at UW.  He is essentially an audio book for the textbook.  You will go through this class and have no idea what you are doing the entire time.
Just a good guy
In his lab section he was great. He could be a bit ramble-y, but it was all useful information for the lab. I highly recommend Saatchi's lab section above all others
Gives time in office hours.

Saatchi is basically just a bad tour guide for the textbook. He points at a few pictures and then mumbles around for an hour. As long as you show up for the in class quizzes having done the end of chapter fill in the blank questions you will be fine. The tests are a combination of those and the practice exam. Inspirational was a joke.
Great professor, just memorize the questions because it's pretty much word for word that's on the tests.
good guy

Saatchi blunders through his lectures like a confused lemur. He mumbles and loses his train of thought with ridiculous frequency. There's no reason to go to class. The average grade is an AB and if you put in an hour or two of work before the exam you'll get an A. Exams are word for word the practice exams.

Saatchi is the worst thing to come through campus since the blizzard of '78. Definition of a joke class. Could have been interesting, but instead this dude (who is very smart, btw, just can't teach to save his life) just stands there an mumbles off slides.

He's a great guy, but his teaching style is just bad. Mumbles, writes in hard to read cursive, doesn't talk loud and is very confusing on his expectations. Although, his quizzes are straight from the book and the exams are the book's homework problems too (and he gives you the answers ahead of time).

I can't believe some of the comments here. Prof Saatchi has inspired me to go further in materials science. He was always available for deep discussions of the course material, and I actually felt that he illuminated some of the drudgery of our boring textbook. His English is a bit rusty, but his dedication and desire for us to learn was huge...

Be prepared to spend at least half of your time deciphering what Saatchi is mumbling on about in lecture. If you don't read the book, you will likely fail the course. So far, all of the quiz and exam material has been copied word for word from the book. Material science is actually an interesting subject, but this guy makes it nearly unbearable....

I took this class expecting it to be one of the more difficult ones, however; it turned out to be one of the easiest. Just read the book before lecture and do the homework assignments on a weekly basis and you'll pass with an A-B. That being said i rarely attended his class, but i did use his office hours and the TA's as well.

Very nice guy, he just can't teach. Mumbles throughout lecture. The homework expects us to know much more than what was taught, and they are not very helpful to your overall grade. Halfway through the semester, he announced that TAs are hosting review sessions every week. I learn more from those than I do from lecture; they're what saved my grade.

Based on the tags I used above, it may seem like this is a great course, but I'll be honest: Saatchi inspired me to never take a Materials Science class again. The fact that I sat through lectures three times a week was hilarious, as I didn't learn a thing in the four months of classes. The lectures amazed me as they were regurgitated PPT slides

To call Ahmad Saatchi a professor would be a gross inaccuracy.  He is more of a guide whose sole purpose is to tell you what chapter to read in the very non-descriptive textbook.  A solution manual will go a long way in this class. Best of luck, you're gunna need it...

Lectures: You may rather want to hit the bar at 8:50 on Monday morning.  Homework: Really only helpful for the quizzes. Doesn't help for preparing for exams.  Quizzes: Usually copied straight from textbook, sometimes still has the answer accidentally circled.  Exams: Buy a magic 8 ball.  Overall nice guy, cant teach

Saatchi is very clueless in this course. He is very unclear about what homework is assigned and you end up doing whole chapters anyway which take an absurd amount of time. Mumbles through power-points during lecture. The quizzes come straight from the books homework so if you memorize the answer  you can get those right. Tests are random and hard
If I could give him zeros I would. Everything said in previous reviews of him are all accurate. I go to lecture everyday and I could get a D.

He wants us to learn the material and he's trying but the man doesn't know his head from his feet. Too much homework. You have to read the book to learn anything and his quizzes range from obscure information you skipped over while studying to a copy of the homework.

Bad professor! Doesn't teach material at all. He is just awful at answering questions. Doesn't follow any sort of logical progression and expects students to memorize book. Gives insane amounts of homework and tests on very obscure and useless parts of the text. Absolutely the worst professor that I have ever had.  Just Awful.

Okay, I know he was hired after the semester started and he had to just jump in. That is fair. Since then though he does not understand how much work he assigns. This chapter 8 due had 126 questions plus 5 others. You really have to memorize the book. Many people have dropped this class. I wanted to really like this class but very disappointed...

Clueless... All the info he spits out is right from the PPT slides provided with the text. And if a student asks a question, he tells us to look in the book 50% of the time. Plus the book is useless and nearly impossible to understand. He never makes clear his expectations for HW. My only advice is do the online HW cause quizzes are based on that.

He is an awful professor. He has no idea how to teach or even what to teach. He simply reads off of the provided powerpoints and he is impossible to understand. Whatever he says the TA's say the opposite. His tests are impossible and there is tons of homework.

Saatchi may as well be a text-to-speech robot. He stands at the front of the lecture hall mumbling through powerpoint slides.  He is also not helpful when you ask questions, and often can't understand what you are asking. The TA's are just as clueless as the students as to what we should be studying or learning because of his lack of communication.

Terrible. That is the only word I can use to describe this professor. Do whatever possible to avoid any association with his teaching.  He assigns almost every single end of chapter question on a weekly basis (50-100 questions). His lectures are impossible to follow, and in no way does he prepare you for his impossible tests.
He is the worst professor anyone will ever have. Doesn't know how to use the internet so you cant keep up if you don't go and he can not teach.

Saatchi is without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had. Test questions are very specific and very hard to study for. Mumbles through lecture and reads straight from slides that he got from the book.  Lecture is basically useless. If you can avoid him do it at all costs,  this class is a nightmare!

Saatchi is the worst professor in the entire school. He is rude to students. He fails to answer questions asked in class. His tests are ridiculous unless you can memorize 150 pages of material in 3 weeks.  He flat out doesn't care about students. Good luck in this class as he is the only professor...

Very quiet and mumbles through lectures which are almost useless. He talks about very broad topics in lecture and then asks very specific questions on the tests which are hard. He is hard to get a hold of and I still have not left a lecture with a sure picture of what the HW was and what was going on the class. He tries, but he is still bad.
